Storytelling makes us humans. From fairytales to epic hero stories, we have been telling and retelling stories from time immemorial. The stories we grew up with help us make sense of our world and what it means to be human. Tales and fables offer a fantastical source of material that we can tap on to confront our real-life problems, even as grown-ups. 

Our ancestors used to sit around a fire, under the cover of night and stars, swapping tales and stealing stories. There is a belief that storytelling evolved as a way of socially binding us as a species. 

At a time like now, we need the solidarity the act of storytelling grants us more than ever.

Tomorrow, in collaboration with @susannacrossman_, we invite you to @sapling___ to rediscover the delight of play through the sharing of childhood stories.

Address: 124 Mount Street Mews, London W1K 3NR

Time: 12-8PM (drop in anytime)

Check out our Instagram stories and take part in an immersive audio experience.

Exhibition Design: @alicepenner_ 
Sound Design: @alistairramage 
Curators: @naomi.y.lea @isabellaong.io

What becomes of us when we play? According to six-year-old Jeanne, âIf all the children in the world play at the same time, it grows. It grows and grows.â [1]

But play does not belong only to children.

Next Saturday, in collaboration with @susannacrossman_ , we bring to @sapling___ a gathering of storytelling, nostalgia and hands-on play; a space to be curious, carefree and captivated. 

Address: 124 Mount Street Mews, London W1K 3NR

Time: 12 - 8 PM (anytime drop in)

Check out our Instagram story and take part in an immersive audio experience.

We invite you to leave your inhibitions at the door and come play with us.

[1] The play cure by Susanna Crossman #linkinbio

We are proud to present our first Instagram based curation 'Please do touch the artworkâ, which focuses on how 'touch' impacts our sense of being.

Over the next month, we will be presenting a lively collection of projects, essays, AR filter, and sounds, delving into the world of touch and its affect.

Please check our posts, stories, and highlights regularly. #soundon 
We hope you enjoy the curation as much as we did to create it.
